p: In recent years, reviews have been published referring to essential oils from Myrtaceaeâ€™s largest genera, such as Myrcia, Eugenia, and Syzygium [ 15, 16]. A review of essential oils from Myrtaceae describing various chemical analyses of Psidium species has also been published [ 17]. However, there is no review focusing jointly on the chemical compositions and biological activities of essential oils of Psidium species. Due to the chemical and biological significance of Psidium species, in this review, there are 110 chemical analyses reported of 18 Psidium species growing widespread in the world and their biological activities.
